import Mathlib

/-
Exercise: Suppose that T âˆˆ L(V) has dim V distinct eigenvalues and that S âˆˆ L(V)
has the same eigenvectors as T (not necessarily with the same eigenvalues).
Prove that S T = T S.

We formalize the hypothesis by assuming there is a basis of V consisting of
T-eigenvectors, indexed by some finite type Î¹, with T(b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i and
S(b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i. The conclusion is that S âˆ˜ T = T âˆ˜ S, i.e. S (T v) = T (S v)
for all v.
-/

theorem Axler_exercise_5_20 {K V : Type*} [Field K] [AddCommGroup V] [Module K V]
  [FiniteDimensional K V] (T S : V â†’â‚—[K] V) :
  (âˆƒ (Î¹ : Type*) (b : Basis Î¹ K V) (Î¼ Î½ : Î¹ â†’ K), Fintype Î¹ âˆ§ Function.Injective Î¼ âˆ§
    (âˆ€ i, T (b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i) âˆ§ (âˆ€ i, S (b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i)) â†’
  âˆ€ v, S (T v) = T (S v) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/-
Exercise: Suppose that T âˆˆ L(V) has dim V distinct eigenvalues and that S âˆˆ L(V)
has the same eigenvectors as T (not necessarily with the same eigenvalues).
Prove that S T = T S.

We formalize the hypothesis by assuming there is a basis of V consisting of
T-eigenvectors, indexed by Fin (finrank K V), with T(b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i and
S(b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i. The conclusion is that S âˆ˜ T = T âˆ˜ S.
-/

theorem Axler_exercise_5_20 {K V : Type*} [Field K] [AddCommGroup V] [Module K V]
  [FiniteDimensional K V] (T S : V â†’â‚—[K] V) :
  (âˆƒ (b : Basis (Fin (finrank K V)) K V) (Î¼ Î½ : Fin (finrank K V) â†’ K),
    (âˆ€ i, T (b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i) âˆ§ (âˆ€ i, S (b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i) âˆ§ Function.Injective Î¼) â†’
  âˆ€ v, S (T v) = T (S v) := by
  sorry

Here, \\(\\text{finrank}_K L\\) denotes the finite dimensional rank of \\(L\\) as a vector space over \\(K\\).", "formal_statement": "import Mathlib\nopen Polynom

args.content:
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Basis
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.FiniteDimensional
import Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Basic

open LinearAlgebra

theorem Axler_exercise_5_20 {K V : Type*} [Field K] [AddCommGroup V] [Module K V]
  [FiniteDimensional K V] (T S : V â†’â‚—[K] V) :
  (âˆƒ (b : Basis (Fin (finrank K V)) K V) (Î¼ Î½ : Fin (finrank K V) â†’ K),
    (âˆ€ i, T (b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i) âˆ§ (âˆ€ i, S (b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i) âˆ§ Function.Injective Î¼) â†’
  âˆ€ v, S (T v) = T (S v) := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/-
Exercise: Suppose that T âˆˆ L(V) has dim V distinct eigenvalues and that S âˆˆ L(V)
has the same eigenvectors as T (not necessarily with the same eigenvalues).
Prove that S T = T S.

We formalize the hypothesis by assuming there is a basis of V consisting of
T-eigenvectors, indexed by some finite type Î¹, with T(b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i and
S(b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i. The conclusion is that S âˆ˜ T = T âˆ˜ S.
-/

theorem Axler_exercise_5_20 {K V : Type*} [Field K] [AddCommGroup V] [Module K V]
  [FiniteDimensional K V] (T S : V â†’â‚—[K] V) :
  (âˆƒ (Î¹ : Type*) (b : Basis Î¹ K V) (Î¼ Î½ : Î¹ â†’ K),
    Fintype Î¹ âˆ§ Function.Injective Î¼ âˆ§ (âˆ€ i, T (b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i) âˆ§ (âˆ€ i, S (b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i)) â†’
  S.comp T = T.comp S := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/-
Exercise: Suppose that T âˆˆ L(V) has dim V distinct eigenvalues and that S âˆˆ L(V)
has the same eigenvectors as T (not necessarily with the same eigenvalues).
Prove that S T = T S.

We formalize the hypothesis by assuming there is a basis of V consisting of
T-eigenvectors, indexed by Fin (finrank K V), with T(b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i and
S(b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i. The conclusion is that S âˆ˜ T = T âˆ˜ S (as linear maps).
-/

theorem Axler_exercise_5_20 {K V : Type*} [Field K] [AddCommGroup V] [Module K V]
  [FiniteDimensional K V] (T S : V â†’â‚—[K] V) :
  (âˆƒ (b : Fin (finrank K V) â†’ V) (Î¼ Î½ : Fin (finrank K V) â†’ K),
    LinearIndependent K (fun i => b i) âˆ§ (Submodule.span K (Set.range b) = âŠ¤) âˆ§
    (âˆ€ i, T (b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i) âˆ§ (âˆ€ i, S (b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i) âˆ§ Function.Injective Î¼) â†’
  S.comp T = T.comp S := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/--
Exercise: Suppose that T âˆˆ L(V) has dim V distinct eigenvalues and that S âˆˆ L(V)
has the same eigenvectors as T (not necessarily with the same eigenvalues).
Prove that S T = T S.

We formalize the hypothesis by assuming there is a basis of V consisting of
T-eigenvectors, indexed by Fin (finrank K V), with T(b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i and
S(b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i. The conclusion is that S âˆ˜ T = T âˆ˜ S (as linear maps).
-/

theorem Axler_exercise_5_20 {K V : Type*} [Field K] [AddCommGroup V] [Module K V]
  [FiniteDimensional K V] (T S : V â†’â‚—[K] V) :
  (âˆƒ (b : Fin (FiniteDimensional.finrank K V) â†’ V) (Î¼ Î½ : Fin (FiniteDimensional.finrank K V) â†’ K),
    LinearIndependent K (fun i => b i) âˆ§ Submodule.span K (Set.range b) = âŠ¤ âˆ§
    (âˆ€ i, T (b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i) âˆ§ (âˆ€ i, S (b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i)) â†’
  S.comp T = T.comp S := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

/--
Exercise: Suppose that T âˆˆ L(V) has dim V distinct eigenvalues and that S âˆˆ L(V)
has the same eigenvectors as T (not necessarily with the same eigenvalues).
Prove that S T = T S.

We formalize the hypothesis by assuming there is a finite index type Î¹ and a
family b : Î¹ â†’ V which is a basis of V (expressed by linear independence and
spanning). We assume T and S act diagonally on this basis: T (b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i
and S (b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i. Then S and T commute.
-/

theorem Axler_exercise_5_20 {K V : Type*} [Field K] [AddCommGroup V] [Module K V]
  [FiniteDimensional K V] (T S : V â†’â‚—[K] V) :
  (âˆƒ (Î¹ : Type*) (b : Î¹ â†’ V) (Î¼ Î½ : Î¹ â†’ K) (fint : Fintype Î¹),
    LinearIndependent K (fun i => b i) âˆ§ Submodule.span K (Set.range b) = âŠ¤ âˆ§
    (âˆ€ i, T (b i) = Î¼ i â€¢ b i) âˆ§ (âˆ€ i, S (b i) = Î½ i â€¢ b i)) â†’
  S.comp T = T.comp S := by
  sorry
